What textbooks are used in calculus courses?

Common calculus textbooks include: (1) 'Calculus: Early Transcendentals' by James Stewart, (2) 'Thomas' Calculus' by Weir and Hass, (3) 'Calculus' by Michael Spivak for theoretical courses. Most courses use the latest editions and may provide free online alternatives like OpenStax Calculus.

Attendance policies vary by course: (1) Most lecture courses don't require attendance but strongly recommend it, (2) Lab and discussion sections often have mandatory attendance with penalties for absences, (3) Some courses allow 1-2 unexcused absences before grade impact, (4) Participation grades (5-10%) incentivize attendance. Medical excuses require documentation.
